title: Your Cape Cod winter guide: 20 things to do during the cold months
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: The Cape Cod winter guide suggests 20 activities across various interests including museums, outdoor trails, restaurants, and breweries.
Visitors can explore the Sandwich Glass Museum, Cape Cod Museum of Art, and Wydah Pirate Museum.
Outdoor options include trails like the Great Island Trail, Nauset Beach, and Herring Cove Beach at Cape Cod National Seashore.

title: She’s running Boston for people like her with Type 1 Diabetes
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Kristine Lapczynski, 30, a Boston Marathon runner, aims to inspire others with Type 1 Diabetes through her participation.
Lapczynski was diagnosed with Type 1 Diabetes over 23 years ago and has faced life-threatening diabetic ketoacidosis.
She is running for Breakthrough T1D to support research and advocacy for Type 1 Diabetes patients.

title: She picked up running at age 45. Now at 61, she’s on track for her Six Star medal.
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Andrea Nwamarah, 61, from Simpsonville, S.C., started running at 45 and is aiming for her Six Star medal.
Nwamarah will run the Boston Marathon for the MEB Foundation, promoting youth health and leadership through sports.
She sees running Boston as a prestigious honor and aims to give back through her fundraising efforts.

title: Boston Marathon runner inspired by aunt’s blindness raises money for the visually impaired
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Paige Stopperich, 29, from Somerville, runs the 2026 Boston Marathon inspired by her aunt's blindness.
She runs for the Massachusetts Association for the Blind and Visually Impaired as part of 'Team With A Vision.'
MABVI offers low-vision rehabilitation, assistive technology, and mobility training to help those with vision loss.

title: Drake Maye says he doesn’t regret marrying young. What readers said.
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Drake Maye, Patriots quarterback, endorses early marriage, sharing he does not regret marrying young to Anne Michael Maye.
Boston.com readers offered mixed reactions to young marriages, ranging from successful decades-long unions to warnings against it.
Comments highlighted that early marriage can be stabilizing but acknowledged it isn't a universal solution for everyone.

title: Driver accused of killing art collector in Back Bay hit-and-run deemed mentally incompetent
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: William R. Haney Jr. deemed mentally incompetent to stand trial for killing art collector John Axelrod in hit-and-run.
Haney, diagnosed with schizophrenia, faced charges of murder and animal cruelty for striking Axelrod and his dog.
Haney remanded to Bridgewater State Hospital for further evaluation to restore mental competency for trial.

title: Mass. pols decry the SAVE America Act. Will it really disenfranchise voters?
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: The SAVE America Act requiring strict voter ID policies passed the U.S. House, facing criticism from Massachusetts politicians.
The Act mandates proof of citizenship, such as a passport or birth certificate, for federal voter registration.
Critics argue it could disenfranchise millions, especially women and minorities, while supporters claim it's to prevent voter fraud.

title: Mass. woman killed while sunbathing after car drives into residential pool area in Florida
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Massachusetts woman Anastasia Fiona Allman, 65, was killed in Fort Pierce, Florida, after a Jeep entered her residential pool area.
The driver, a 38-year-old woman, crashed through fencing and landscaping, trapping Allman beneath the vehicle.
Preliminary investigation suggests the driver may have suffered a medical episode; she was hospitalized and later released.

title: Review & setlist: Brandi Carlile has tailored her ‘Human Tour’ to humans, beautifully
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Brandi Carlile performed at TD Garden in Boston for her 'Human Tour,' her first arena tour, on February 12, 2026.
Governor Maura Healey declared February 12 as 'Brandi Carlile Day' in Massachusetts during Carlile's concert.
Carlile involved fans by taking song requests and shared personal stories, creating a close-knit concert atmosphere.

title: Delta is bringing back direct flights between Boston and Hawaii
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Delta Air Lines will resume nonstop flights from Boston to Honolulu starting December 19, 2026.
The route, previously canceled due to low demand, will operate daily during peak holiday season, then four times weekly.
Passengers will fly on an Airbus A330-300 as part of Delta's winter seasonal schedule from Logan International Airport.
